conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Chapters 12 through 16 of the main campaign.
Prince Leonidas. Here are the status reports on all the territories in Alberia.
Hand them here.
...Excellent. All is proceeding apace.
Indeed. A sense of ease is washing over the people. It almost feels as if the war looming over us until now was but a bad dream.
We couldn't have done it without your brilliant political insight. Thanks to you, Alberia has averted a true crisis.
Given the strides we've made, now might be a good time to think about taking a rest, sir. Perhaps a vacation is in order?
No need. I don't have the luxury of resting.
We have only just avoided the worst possible outcome. Restoring Alberia to its former glory will be far more laborious a task.
But Your Excellency... You've been working tirelessly for so long. I fear for your health.
Cease. The subject is tabled indefini—
A thousand pardons, Your Excellency. A messenger from the Halidom has come to see you.
From the Halidom, you say? I don't recall us arranging such a visit.
Did the messenger identify himself?
Yes, sir! He called himself Xander, sir!
Well, well! If it isn't the arrogant Alberian upstart. I haven't seen you since that soirée!
Wha—how dare you speak to His Excellency Leonidas in such a way!
Pay it no mind. You'll only give yourself a headache if you obsess over every daft utterance that escapes this cur's lips.
So the biggest mouth in the North has come to me once more. You're just as irritating as ever.
How far you've fallen from grace—I hear you're now a lowly general in my little brother's army.
How misinformed you are. I'm no common foot soldier. I've merely made the young prince my vassal, you see!
Your japes grow wearisome. But enough of that. What have you come here for?
I'm so glad you asked! Duty has led me here, you see...
...to regale you with tales of my most glorious vacation!
Go home. I haven't the time to indulge your braggadocio. Now if you'll excuse me, I have matters that require attention.
Playing the busy card, eh? How utterly unlike you. In the short time we've been apart, you've grown awfully small-minded.
Excuse me...?
When I heard you had cast aside your pride in favor of guiding the people, I was truly impressed.
But now I see you're working yourself to death like a lowly pack mule—one who would spurn the pleasures of summer without a second thought!
Oh, I've thought about it. I've simply decided that now is no time to relax.
Now who's being ＂wearisome＂? Haven't you considered how you might be worrying those who serve you?
What sort of ruler causes his vassals undue concern?!
He who would call himself king must always keep an open mind. Otherwise, none will follow him!
And so! You should read my vacation diary and learn to embrace some latitude.
*sigh* You are incorrigible. Of COURSE that was your ultimate goal.
I'll say it once more, and never again: I have no interest in your ridiculous summer dia—
Hold. Am I reading this right...?
Pretty fantastic, eh? You must be awfully jealous of what a great vacation I had!
I see. So that's what this was all about.
Fine. Just this once, I'll take your advice.
Heh. I knew you'd see reason.
No need to thank me, by the way. It is a king's duty to help his vassals, their stubborn older brothers included.
But this is as far as I'll meddle. The rest is up to you, Leonidas.
Just you wait and see, Xander.
I'll show you how a REAL ruler goes on vacation!
It has been some time indeed since I last set foot upon these sands...
Well, this is a relief. It's about time His Excellency took a break.
That's for sure. Still...
Still?
Er... Well, I'm having a hard time picturing how His Excellency would even SPEND a vacation.
That's...a fair point, actually.
Now that we're here, there's only one true way to enjoy a vacation. All of you, come with me.
Yes, sir!
*gulp* So begins His Excellency Leonidas's vacation. Who knows what lies in store?
First, we need some nourishment. Let us visit the nearest beach cafe.
Isn't that a bit of a dive?! For someone of your standing, I mean?
When at the beach, eat like the beach-goers do, I say.
Now, let's see if their curry can live up to my standards.
Oh, geez... This could turn ugly real fast.
Agreed. His Excellency adores curry more than anything. If they bring him something that falls below his expectations...
At best, the owner will get a firm scolding. At worst, the beach will be shut down for good!
Let's hope their recipe is up to snuff...
Hello. Is the owner in?
Yes, of course! Come right on— Prince Leonidas?!
I would like curry. Your best, if you would.
Yes, sir! Right away, sir! I'll get right on it!
Here you are, Your Excellency!
Hm. You have my thanks.
*nervous fidgeting*
(Well? Does their cuisine reign supreme? Or is their gastronomy a catastrophe?!)
Not bad. But your preparation needs work if you hope to satisfy me.
(Oh, geez... This joint—no, this whole beach is done for!)
Owner.
I beg your forgiveness, Your Excellency! Please, have mercy!
I'd like to borrow your kitchen, if I may.
Huh? Oh, er... By all means.
Here. The trick is in the secret ingredient: a nut paste.
Wait, really? You can use that in curry?
Indeed. The slight sweetness of the nuts will give the roux an even richer flavor.
I see! I've learned something new today!
...And that's how you make the perfect curry. I take it you wrote that all down?
Yes, of course! Never in my wildest dreams would I have imagined I'd get culinary advice from Prince Leonidas himself. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!
Your thanks are not necessary. The strong are meant to guide the weak.
After this, you should share the recipe for this curry with the other surrounding huts and make it a specialty of this beach.
Not only did he keep his cool—he even went out of his way to teach the owner proper curry-making techniques...
His Excellency is being so much nicer than usual. I wonder why.
For the record, I can hear you.
A thousand pardons, Your Excellency! I was just... You know...!
I do not mean to admonish you. After all, my behavior is indeed outside the norm.
But...why, sir?
Because this is my personal time.
I am not here as a noble. I am here as a simple gourmand, and I wished to give the owner some advice on how to improve.
Now, then. I've satisfied my hunger, so perhaps I shall see how the water feels.
Hold it, you! Swimming is strictly off-limits right n—
PRINCE LEONIDAS?! I beg your pardon for my most ungracious behavior, Your Highness!
I took no offense. More importantly, why is swimming presently prohibited?
Well, for the past few days, the waves have gotten particularly violent with no sign of settling down.
As the caretaker here, I judged the danger too great. Though it pained me, I had to do something in the name of public safety.
Hm... Duly noted. I suppose that takes swimming off the table, then.
Yes. Thank you for understanding. Now, I must ask that you turn ba—
That won't be necessary.
Huh? B-but you just agreed that swimming is not an option.
Indeed. Swimming is not.
But we humans need not yield to the laws of nature. There are more ways to enjoy the sea than with a breaststroke or a doggy paddle.
For instance, if we were to make use of a certain tool...
As I thought. This weather is perfect for surfing.
Conquering larger waves like this makes the challenge all the more worth it!
Incredible! Only someone as amazing as Prince Leonidas could ride the waves so magnificently!
While that is most impressive... Do you see his expression?
That's the first time I've ever seen him look so content.
He really is acting different. I had no idea he was capable of letting loose like that.
Things are so calm now, and he's been able to relax on a proper vacation at last.
Finally, he can get the rest his mind and body have so deserved.
Ah... Such lovely weather.
I think I shall spend some time sunbathing and reading. The rest of you can relax however you please.
Yes, sir!
How is the Prince doing?
All is well, Captain. He's just been tanning on the beach.
He's been enjoying his time off to the fullest. When I crept over to check on him, I found that he was sleeping soundly.
His Excellency is NAPPING?! Like a regular person?!
It's no wonder why—he's been busier than ever. He put on a tough face, but it seems like he really was exhausted.
The sun will be setting soon. You all go prepare for dinner.
This is a perfect opportunity to knock his royal socks off with a dish so good, it'll make this trip his most memorable ever.
Yes, sir!
＂A perfect opportunity＂ indeed. Heh heh heh...
Prince he may be, but Leonidas is only human. He couldn't fight off his fatigue, and now he's left himself wide open.
(He really is sleeping, just like they said. If I strike now—!)
Mmngh...
(Drat! Of all the times!)
Hm? What is it? Did you need something, Captain?
No, sir! Er... It's just, the sun was setting, so I was coming to wake you!
Hm. Is it that time already? I suppose we should return to our lodgings.
Yes, Your Excellency!
The next day...
I appreciate all of your hard work in attending to me during this vacation. As thanks, I've decided to hold a banquet this evening.
For US, Your Excellency?! We are beyond honored!
Use this time to rejuvenate yourselves after several days' hard work. Now, begin the preparations!
What a relief! I can't wait for tonight!
A banquet, eh? I can work with that...
I hope you'll join us for the fun too, Captain! ...Huh? Where'd he go?
That's odd. He was here just a moment ago.
I bring news. Tonight, Leonidas will be throwing a banquet for his entourage at their lodgings.
You serious, Boss?! Man, talk about a lucky break!
The guards'll be completely lax during the banquet. If we seize that window of opportunity...
We can kill Leonidas!
Hell yeah! And once he's outta the picture, we'll take over Valkaheim!
Who gives a crap about leading the weak?! We're going back to the days of the strong taking all they can get!
That's the spirit, men. Tonight, we kill Leonidas!
That blackguard and his retinue have at last let their guards down.
I knew we'd have a shot during this vacation. I'd been waiting for the perfect opportunity...and it's finally here!
(The old Leonidas would never have exposed himself like this.)
(Valkaheim used to be all about the survival of the fittest. He used to embody that! He never would have shown this kind of weakness!)
(But then he lost to his brother. And with that, he lost his power. His ideals. Everything! The conqueror I so admired is dead and gone!)
(The only reason I stuck around in his military was so I could cut him down when he least expected it!)
Let's rid ourselves of the coward Leonidas and take back the great nation of Valkaheim ourselves!
YEAH!!!
So that's where Leonidas is staying.
All right. We'll wait here. Once everyone's gotten all settled in, our boss'll come out and give us the signal.
Got it!
It would seem preparations are complete. Let the feasting begin!
Ha ha ha! This is a blast and a half. C'mon, you guys! Party hardy!
MAN, I'm stuffed. Couldn't eat another bite if my life depended on it.
(Heh heh... This is good. These guys don't suspect a thing.)
(And how is our royal apostate doing?)
The banquet has only just begun, but I've had my fill. Men, feel free to linger and enjoy yourselves to your hearts' content.
Understood, sir!
(He's going back to his room alone!)
Oh! The boss man's out!
Now's our chance! The guards are all distracted, and Leonidas has retired alone!
You guys handle the soldiers. I'll take care of Leonidas!
You got it, Boss!
This is it... Chaaarge!
Attack! Those soldiers are nothing now that they're dis—
Not so fast, Captain!
So it had to come to this... How truly regrettable.
What?! Why are you all—
Is it not obvious? You walked into my trap with frankly embarrassing aplomb.
I knew you were a traitor, Captain.
No... What gave me away?!
If you draw your sword by your sleeping master, he's bound to notice.
Wait... Don't tell me you were only pretending to sleep!
Hmph. Rather slow to realize, this one.
But if you knew... Why didn't you take me in right then and there?!
I only let you run free because I'd realized you were not acting alone.
The banquet was nothing but a pretense for luring you and your little friends out so I could catch you all in one fell swoop.
That's... That's ridiculous!
While you left to speak with your group, I  ordered the rest of the soldiers to pretend they were distracted by the banquet.
We're ready for anything you throw our way! You won't be getting past us!
Grrrgh...
You were an upstanding subordinate. At least, until my brother defeated me.
Thus do I offer a sliver of mercy. If you surrender, I'll allow you to escape with your lives. However, if you resist, I shall give no quarter.
Hey, Boss? I don't think we're gettin' outta this one...
I don't wanna die!
Dammit... I thought you'd gone soft, but your fangs are as sharp as ever!
So WHY, then?! If you're still this strong, why won't you rule with an iron fist the way you used to?!
If you can't figure that out for yourself, you have no right to call yourself my subordinate.
Soldiers, seize those traitors!
Yes, sir!
To think there really were people after Prince Leonidas's head, just as he predicted...
And what's worse, the Captain was the one pulling all the strings! When His Excellency first told us, I couldn't believe my ears.
If I may ask, sir: when did you realize there was someone coming after you?
I think it should be quite obvious.
I knew from the very start.
I'll say it once more, and never again: I have no interest in your ridiculous summer dia—
Hold. Am I reading this right...?
Be careful, Leonidas! Your life is in danger!
I learned of it as I was on my travels with  Euden. There is an interloper within Valkaheim's palace walls. He and his gang want to catch you unaware and kill you.
I figured this would be a way to bear the news to you without anyone else knowing. I know, I know. What magnanimity!
However arrogant you may be, you are also quite capable. I look forward to seeing how you clean this little mess up! Ha ha ha!
Pretty fantastic, eh? You must be awfully jealous of what a great vacation I had!
I see. So that's what this was all about.
(I can only surmise that this letter is referring to the Captain. Now it's all beginning to make sense.)
(Ever since what happened with my brother, he's been acting quite suspicious. It seems this is the cause.)
Fine. Just this once, I'll take your advice.
It was at that moment that I devised this plan to draw out these conspirators.
If I made them think I was lost in some sort of summertime reverie, I knew they would jump at the chance to attack me as soon as the moment was right.
M-my word... So it wasn't just the banquet. The whole vacation was part of your plan!
You truly are a genius! Your foresight is rivaled by none!
But of course.
(You see this, Xander? This is how I handle things!)
We've completed all objectives. Begin the withdrawal.
Yes, sir!
Man, Prince Leonidas really is incredible. I never suspected this whole vacation was part of some larger plan.
You can say that again. Just goes to show how superior he is to us average Joes.
Y'know, watching him have so much fun in the sun, I genuinely started to feel like I could relate to the guy. Guess I was hasty.
Oh, you mean when he was making curry at that beach hut and surfing and stuff?
Yeah. I suppose it was all a ruse—all to make the enemy come out of hiding...
It's such a shame. I really was hoping His Excellency could take some ＂me time.＂
You seem to be laboring under a misunderstanding. I did in fact do just that.
You...did?!
Then you really were enjoying yourself?
Are you telling me you lured your enemies into a trap and had yourself a vacation at the same time?!
Indeed. It was just what I needed to unwind.
Truly, never has there been a greater master of killing two birds with one stone.
Hm... No, that's not quite accurate.
It's not? Then...?
You'll see soon enough.
We're going back to Valkaheim now. Keep up.
Yes, Your Excellency!
A short time later...
Come one, come all! This beach is the only place you can try Prince Leonidas's secret curry recipe!
His Excellency devised this? Why, it's marvelous!
*munch* *munch* More, please! I want seconds. No, thirds!
Dude! I'd heard the buzz, but the real deal is so much sweeter. These waves are one seriously wild ride!
You can say that again. I sure am glad we came all the way out here!
Welcome, welcome! I take it seasoned surfers like yourselves are interested in a more challenging spot? I'll lead the way!
Suh-weeet. Let's do it!
The local economy has improved significantly. All those new specialties have drawn tourists from all reaches of the land.
And where people go, money follows. The restaurants and lodgings on the way to the beach and its surrounding areas are profiting from its success as well.
Ultimately, we can surmise that revenue for that region will be twice—no, three times that of the previous year.
Understood. Thank you for the report.
Hey, did you hear that?
Yeah... All the stuff Prince Leonidas did wound up giving the whole area around the beach a serious shot in the arm!
Now I understand why he said he wasn't taking out two birds with one stone...
He was going for THREE!
He was dealing with the seditionists, revitalizing the local economy, and having a fun vacation all at once!
He's a man among men! All hail Prince Leonidas!
That really seals the deal. I'll follow him for as long as I live!
As will I. With him at the helm, this kingdom's future is bright!
It would appear morale is at an all-time high, Your Excellency.
I wouldn't have it any other way. They are MY subordinates, after all.
And my subordinates must be ever at the ready to assist in my path to conquest.
